greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the first digit to appear n times in succession in a power of 2.
comment: Assumes that there are no 2 digits that appear n times in succession for the first time in the same power of 2. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Apr 26 2019
example: 2^16 = 65536 is the first power of 2 with a repeated digit (cf. A045875), with 5 repeated, so a(2) = 5. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 23 2012
mathematica: z = Split[IntegerDigits[x]]; a = Length /@ z; b = Max[a];
program: l, x = [str(d)*n for d in range(10)], 1
results.author: _V. Raman_, Aug 22 2012
